analysis.title: A History of Fools
analysis.author: Unknown
analysis.logline: A precocious 13-year-old boy sues his parents for emancipation, using his razor-sharp intellect and accumulated evidence to legally separate himself from their guardianship.

concept.justification: Unique premise of a hyper-intelligent 13-year-old legally divorcing his parents, blending legal drama with coming-of-age comedy

structure.justification: Clear three-act structure with compelling progression from home life to legal battle to unexpected resolution

protagonist.justification: Miles is an extraordinarily complex, articulate protagonist with clear goals, active agency, and a nuanced character arc

supporting_cast.justification: Rich ensemble including Layla, Elliot, Keyshon, Nate, and parents with distinct voices and narrative purpose

dialogue.justification: Razor-sharp, witty dialogue that reveals character and advances plot with exceptional verbal dexterity

genre_execution.justification: Masterfully balances comedy, drama, and legal procedural elements with consistent tone

originality.justification: Distinctive voice, unexpected narrative turns, and a fresh perspective on family dynamics

cast_attachability.note: Strong lead role for young actor, supporting roles for comedic talents

budget_return_ratio.note: Low-budget potential with high commercial appeal

comparable_success.note: Similar to Wes Anderson's stylized coming-of-age films

structure_analysis.act_breaks: Domestic setup, legal battle, resolution and reconciliation

characters.protagonist: Miles Calhoun - hyper-intelligent, manipulative 13-year-old with clear goal of legal independence
characters.antagonist: Parents Gary and Meredith, representing systemic parental constraints

standout_scenes.why: Establishes protagonist's precocious intelligence and sardonic worldview
Masterful legal theatrics showcasing Miles' strategic thinking

budget_tier.justification: Limited locations, young cast, dialogue-driven narrative

development_notes: Moderate age adjustment for romantic elements
Additional legal consultation to enhance procedural authenticity
assessment.recommendation_rationale: High weighted score, zero critical failures, exceptional commercial viability score, and a distinctive narrative voice make this a compelling development opportunity.

analysis.verdict_statement: Based on its extraordinary dialogue, inventive concept, and Miles' captivating narrative voice, this screenplay demonstrates commercial viability and craft execution that warrant immediate development consideration. The protagonist presents a uniquely attachable role for a young, breakout talent.
